p.i: Clusters and resources use servers with a particular server-role.

body.p: You're going to be running the services on physical servers, and you're going to need a way to specify which type of servers you want to use where. This is defined via the server-role. Each server-role describes how to configure the physical aspects of a server to fulfill the needs of a particular role. You'll generally use a different role whenever the servers are physically different (have different disks or network interfaces) or if you want to use some specific servers in a particular role (for example to choose which of a set of identical servers are to be used in the control plane).

Each server-role has a relationship to two other entities, the disk-model and the interface-model:
The disk-model specifies how to configure and use its local storage. This is described in the next section.
The interface-model describes how its network interfaces are to be configured and used. This is covered in more details in the networking section.
